reviews.title: Easy and simple
reviews.text: No issues, went through a third party but will probably go to NCBS direct next time as so easy.

reviews.title: Good rate and quick product transfer
reviews.text: I stayed with Newcastle Building Society after 2 years into my mortgage. They offered very good rate and the process was really simple to switch.

reviews.title: Wasting people's time
reviews.text: After offering us £20,000 more than we wanted on a mortgage principal certificate we decided to go with them both of us have good jobs and an excellent credit rating without a reason decided to decline the mortgage why offer a mortgage in principle if you take it away there slogan is to look after the people of the North East what a load of rubbish

reviews.title: Great rates and service
reviews.text: Everything has been simple and efficient with our mortgage application. The service has been brilliant and the rate is very competitive. I don't ever want to move my mortgage.

reviews.title: Mortgage application
reviews.text: Newcastle Building Society provided exactly what we needed in a mortgage for our new home. Communication was prompt and efficient, everything completed on schedule and we received a lovely welcome pack once we moved in! Great service!

reviews.title: Good service and competitive rates
reviews.text: I have to confess I didn't look too hard for a mortgage. I was happy with the rate I found for the newcastle building society and the service has always been great...so quite happy.

reviews.title: Very easy to use and good interest
reviews.text: Simple, straightforward and no issues.

reviews.title: Easy to open and great account
reviews.text: The online journey was simple and the account will help save for a house deposit

reviews.title: Wish I Had Not Switched
reviews.text: I chose to switch my LISA from a stocks and shares to cash and as Newcastle had the best interest rate at the time I switched to them. I now massively regret not reading the reviews. It took 2 months to transfer the money between the accounts and this meant I nearly missed the deadline for receiving my bonus. I also never received details for online banking and had to go through a painful process of letters and calls to get access. I am now in the process of drawing the money out for the purchase of my home and hope that I have a smoother experience then when I put it in. If doing again I would avoid Newcastle at the expense of the extra 0.2% interest I would earn.

reviews.title: Incompetent
reviews.text: Applied online and told to either fund account before it was open or wait till postal confirmation saying it’s open. No confirmation received months after so thanking my lucky stars I did not send my money into a black hole!! Off to find a company that can actually open an account...

reviews.title: Poor customer and extremely slow service
reviews.text: I applied for mortgage with Newcastle. The mortgage was agreed in principle and valuation was done on 2 April 2019 and I am still waiting for my mortgage offer. What a disgrace. I am sorry I applied and thoroughly disgusted with the pace. I am ashamed to be associated with Newcastle.

reviews.title: Long-term saving
reviews.text: Easy to open, great customer service and my idea of a really great offer.

reviews.title: Great telephone service
reviews.text: I was locked out of my online account (apparently because it had become inactive...I hadn't logged in for a while). But calling them up this morning proved to be very easy. No wait time and very friendly service!

reviews.title: This was a great product...
reviews.text: Logged in the other night to find that this account is no more. Instead of a good interest rate product, I've been moved to a sub <1% savings account. Not great. Looking for somewhere else to move my money too now!

reviews.title: Great face to face customer service
reviews.text: I was informed that Newcastle Building Society would no longer be accepting standing orders, so I tried to set-up a different instruction. Unfortunately something went wrong and a subsequent payment I made to them was rejected. However, when I went into the Linthorpe Road branch, J Roberts was very helpful and dealt with my query quickly...still not sure why the payment was rejected though!

reviews.title: Good interest rate and friendly telephone staff
reviews.text: I opened an account with them because the rate they were offering was one of the best around. Forgot my password a few times, and locked my account...but staff on the phone were really helpful! Recommended

reviews.title: No compassion or understanding for members
reviews.text: I have a lot of money in a 5 year bond taken out when interest rates were very low. I politely asked if I could renegotiate the interest rate by a couple of percentage points but was told no. Whilst I understand that I had a contract I would have liked them to demonstrate some compassion, especially in view of how much their CEO and others are earning.

reviews.title: Great customer service
reviews.text: The staff in my local branch are always so friendly!

reviews.title: 5 out of 5 stars...from me
reviews.text: Ray Sisterson 49 reviews GB Rated 5 out of 5 stars 2nd to none I have been helped today i can not tell you how far this person went to see me right today 100 % Fantastic could not ask for any better so thank you Laura Moorhead 5* from me Date of experience: 15 April 2025

reviews.title: Avoid at all costs
reviews.text: Accused my wife of money laundering when she tried to transfer an ISA to them. Other companies do online checks within seconds but these idiots are incapable of that. Customer Services can only repeat 'Computer says no'. Absolutely useless company.i

reviews.title: No longer a market leader
reviews.text: I joined the Newcastle BS when their "Big Home Saver" regular savings account was a market leader, paying about 3% . Over the last few years the rate has gradually declined to the point where I abandoned the society to pursue better rates elsewhere. Service with Newcastle was always good in my experience, although the online banking service was a little clunky. Overall a B+ (could do better!)

reviews.title: Nice idea but rates still low
reviews.text: I think that this account is a clever thing for the Newcastle Building Society to do - in that it gives a little back to charity. However, for every £1000 in this account, the charity gets just £1 per year and the customer £10. At a 1.1% rate this is low, but top marks on the intention.

reviews.title: TOONARMY
reviews.text: Do a great job for our local hero and legend wot sir Bobby Robson

reviews.title: An amazing service provided!
reviews.text: Newcastle Building Society provides some of the best service I have ever regularly received on the high street. Their attention to communication is excellent. Service isn't limited to requests, they always go the extra mile to find out whether more help is required and assuring my products are suitable and long term financial well being considered.

reviews.title: The Best
reviews.text: put 10,000 in 3% for 5 years brilliant

reviews.title: Frriendly, Efficient Service
reviews.text: Local offices with friendly staff who get to know you and your financial needs. Good old fashioned service from a modern, forward thinking financial institution which still has customers interests at the heart of it.

reviews.title: Helped and well guided throughout
reviews.text: My review is about the personal touch the newcastle provided when I was securing a mortgage. Would have no difficulty to recommend to a friend or family member.
